page.title: 09Education in Ballingry
page.content: In this area there are three primary schools,{BENARTY}with a roll of 335, {CROSSHILL}(152),and{St. KENNETH'S RC} {SCHOOL}with nursery (131).{DUNMORE} {NURSERY}has about 40 pre-school children. At present, Crosshill and Benarty children transfer to{BALLINGRY {JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL}(roll 433), though this year more than a third have opted to go instead to Beath High. When the new Lochgelly High School opens in a few years' time, Ballingry JHS will close. It seems likely that the BJHS building will be converted for use as a primary, and Benarty and Crosshill will close. St. Kenneth's pupils move on to St. Columba's in Dunfermline. Attached to the BJHS building is a {SPECIAL EDUCATION UNIT}whose present roll of 57 children come from a large part of west Fife. David Comiskey (12)
